subject: Re: [junit] FW: How to parametrize TestCases?
msgSnippet: ... JUnit-addons library: PropertyManager class: 1) create one property file for all your tests 2) reference it as a System property (-D option) 3) in your
messageBody:
> For example, if my test requires user name and password, I don't want to
> hardcode this information in the test itself, but rather pass it in, either
> through command line arguments or some property file entries.

JUnit-addons library: PropertyManager class:

1) create one property file for all your tests
2) reference it as a System property (-D option)
3) in your tests: PropertyManager.getProperty(...)

-Vladimir

--
